chapter.title: Portal Functions
chapter.para: This chapter describes the common functions performed by Opics Portal. For each transaction type (or product), the portal provides a module that enables you to initiate, amend, and monitor transactions on behalf of your company. These modules provide similar set of functions as described in this chapter.
For basic features common to all modules, such as basic terminology and the behavior of lists, see About This Manual and Getting Started section.

section.title: Portlets
section.para: The Recent Pending Transactions list within the Trade Events portlet on your Home page shows recent events in all modules. This portlet is provided by the Trade Calendar module.

section.title: Validation and Submission
section.para: Several types of validation are done when you fill in an input form.
First, each field is validated as you enter it. Errors that can be detected by local validation of the field are indicated by a popup message as soon as the cursor leaves the field.

When you have completed a form and you click on Request or Submit, the form is checked to ensure that all mandatory fields are filled in. If not, you get an error message and the first uncompleted mandatory field is highlighted.

Once all mandatory fields are filled in, Request or Submit sends the form to the back-office software for more detailed validation. If any errors are detected, you get a message box with the text "A validation error has occurred" and a More> link.
Click More> to see a list of the errors. The first few lines may be general error messages such as "Failed to execute request" and "Failed to validate ...". The actual error messages then follow.

At certain points in filling in a form, you can click a button (for example, Search on some forms) to cause an action for which data has to be sent to the back-office software. This too gives you the message box if any errors are detected.

If you clicked Request or Submit and no errors are found, the back-office software assigns a bank reference to your transaction. You get the Submit transaction-type Initiation page, which displays the message "Your transaction-type with Bank Reference number has been successfully submitted".

tip.para: Ensure that you make a note of the bank reference number.

section.title: Main Menu
section.para: The Main Menu, located on the left side, provides a list of modules and features in Opics Portal. The items in this menu depend on which modules your account has permissions for.

section.title: Module Functions
section.para: You enter the submenu of a module by clicking the corresponding module on the Main menu on your Home page. On the menu for each module are the functions listed in this section.

All the functions in these modules handle only transactions of the type handled by the current module. In many cases the name of the function or set of functions is followed by the name of the asset type handled by the module. For example, in the FX module the menu item shown here as 'Inquiry' is FX Inquiry.

Where it is necessary to include the transaction type we call it trade-type. Thus, in the Term Deposit module, transaction-type is Term Deposit. The individual functions are described in the rest of this chapter.

section.title: Common Functions
section.para: Initiation: Provides a set of functions for creating a request to initiate a transaction, and submitting it to the bank.
Message to Bank: Provides a set of functions for making amendments to a transaction and managing standing instructions for your transactions.
Unsigned: Function to display a list of your company's pending transactions; that is, those that are have Draft or Unsigned status. You can open transactions to edit or submit them.
Inquiry: Function to display a list of your company's files, so you can view their details and optionally print a hard copy of these details.
Maintenance: Provides a set of functions to carry out maintenance tasks, including deleting outdated transactions.

section.title: Operations
section.para: Most functions display a form, with buttons to click and complete the transactions. Some of the common buttons are given below.

entry.para: Initiates a transaction with the bank requesting for information.
Clears all the fields in the form
Performs a look-up based on the search criteria specified in the form. Displays the result if the criteria matched. Else, displays a message indicating that no result is retrieved.
Stores the transaction as a draft, so that you or another user can continue to work on it later. No validation is done. It is not sent to the bank.
Not present on Unsigned forms, as these cannot be edited.
Sends the transaction to the bank. The form is validated, as described in section Validation and Submission.
If you do not have sufficient permissions (for example, to handle the amount you have requested), the transaction is not sent and an error message is displayed. Its status changes to Unsigned.
Saves the transaction as a template, so that you or another user can base new transactions on it. As no validation is done for it, it is not sent to the bank.
Discards the transaction and quits the form without saving it, and returns to the Main menu of the module.
Launches a new window displaying the online help.
Removes the selected transaction from the database.

section.title: Initiating Transactions
section.para: The initiation menu contains functions for creating a transaction and submitting it to the bank.

section.title: From Scratch
section.para: You can create a transaction from scratch and optionally send it to the bank. You can alternatively save it as a template, from which such initiations can be created.

This function displays the New transaction-type (for example, New Loan) input form. You use this form to create your initiation and validate it, save it as a draft, save it as a template, or submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority).
The input form is different for each transaction type. For detailed descriptions of these input forms, see the chapters for the individual transaction types.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: You can continue working on a transaction that you or another user have already started and saved. This function displays a list of Draft or Unsigned transactions created by users in your company.

Click in the System ID column to open the initiation in a New transaction-type input form for further editing, after which you can again validate it, save it as a draft, save it as a template, or submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority).

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This menu contains the following functions.

section.title: Standing Instructions
section.para: You can view and modify standing instruction for your transactions.

section.title: From Existing Transaction-type
section.para: You can view and modify existing transactions and submit them to the bank, for example, you can modify the value date of your FX transactions or split the amount of a particular FX deal. Below is the detailed description of modifying a transaction.

section.title: Inquiry and Maintenance
section.para: This section describes the inquiry and maintenance functions of the portal.
First we describe the Output Format field, common to several of these functions.

section.title: Output Format
section.para: Some functions in this part of the menu have a feature to let you choose the destination and format of the lists they display.

listitem.para: Displays the list on the same web page, in the normal list format.
Downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or Spreadsheet format to export the list as a report, so you can use it or customize it in your office productivity tools. When you click Search, the browser displays the File Download prompt, where you can choose to save the file or open it. Opening it launches Excel if it is available on your workstation.

section.title: Inquiry
section.para: You can check the status, details, and history of transactions. This function displays a list of files (that is, the set of events in a transaction) that your company has initiated.

section.title: Maintenance
section.para: The functions in this part of the menu carry out various maintenance tasks.

section.title: Set Entity
section.para: Only present if your company has entities. Assign an entity to a file (that is, the set of transactions on one trade) that currently has none.

This function displays a list of transactions that have no entity assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign an entity. All transactions of the selected file are updated.
No particular permissions are needed for this action.

section.title: Set Reference
section.para: Only present if your company has customer references.

This function displays a list of transactions that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference. All transactions of the selected file are updated.
No particular permissions are needed for this action.

section.title: Unsigned
section.para: Delete Draft or Unsigned transactions that are out of date and are never submitted.
This function displays a list of Draft or Unsigned transactions.

Click rows to select them (click anywhere in the row – it becomes highlighted), then click Delete selected transactions at the end of the list to delete them. The system will check that you have sufficient authorization.

caution.para: Deleted records are physically removed from the system. This should therefore be done with great care!
